intro: Galium × ochroleucum var. bailletii, commonly known as the white wood-sorrel, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and trifoliate leaves with a pale green to white coloration. The flowers are small, white, and arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This variant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in partial shade.
